00009 class XulIndividual(Individual):
00010     def __init__(self, random, genome_len, genome):
00011         Individual.__init__(self, random, genome_len, genome)
00012         self.rank = 0
00013 
00014     def __cmp__(self, other):
00015         return cmp(self.rank, other.rank)

00018 class Xulgui(app.Application):
00019     def __init__(self, params, random):
00020         app.Application.__init__(self, params, random)
00021         self.geneLen = 0.
00022         self.bits = params['bits']
00023

00025         folder, outputFile = params['folder'], params['output']
00026         fout = open(folder + outputFile, 'w')
00027         fout.write('gen \t max \t avg \t min \t opt \t obj_max \t obj_avg \t obj_min \t subj_max \t subj_avg \t subj_min\n')

00036         self.gridSize = params['rows'] * params['cols']

00044     def createPop(self, popsize):
00045 
00046         #Parse user interface.
00047         #Compute how many widgets there are in the UI.
00048         import xml.dom.minidom
00049         dom = xml.dom.minidom.parse('app/xulgui/'+self.params['ui_file'])
00050         panel = dom.getElementsByTagName('panel')
00051         ui_data = panel[0].cloneNode(True)
00052         dom.unlink()
00053 
00054         self.ELEMENT_NODE = xml.dom.minidom.Node.ELEMENT_NODE
00055         widgetNum = 0
00056 
00057         uiWidgets = {}
00058         # contains actual location of widgets in XML tree
00059         elementNodes = []
00060         # ID list is location in XML tree + 1 in order to prevent having a zero ID value
00061         idList = []
00062         for i in xrange(len(ui_data.childNodes)):
00063             if ui_data.childNodes[i].nodeType == self.ELEMENT_NODE:
00064                 elementNodes.append(i)
00065                 idList.append(i + 1)
00066                 widgetNum += 1
00067 
00068                 # Store in list representation to be used to generate wxPython code
00069                 data = {}
00070                 nodeName = ui_data.childNodes[i].nodeName
00071                 data['name'] = nodeName
00072                 data['value'] = ui_data.childNodes[i].getAttribute('value')
00073                 data['size'] = ui_data.childNodes[i].getAttribute('size')
00074                 if data['size']:
00075                     data['size'] = eval(data['size'])
00076                 uiWidgets[i+1] = data
00077 
00078         self.uiWidgets = uiWidgets
00079 
00080         self.geneLen = widgetNum * self.bits + self.bits
00081         # this is wrong, this is for HSV
00082         self.maxDist = ( (360*360) + (100*100) + (100*100) )**0.5
00083 
00084         import operator
00085         def factorial(x): return reduce(operator.mul, xrange(2, x + 1))
00086 
00087         # count the number of combinations of 2 widgets available
00088         # this counts comparisons between widgets
00089         comps = factorial(widgetNum - 1) / (factorial(widgetNum-1 - 2) * 2)
00090         # this counts comparisons between each widget to window
00091         comps += widgetNum - 1
00092 
00093         # objective component bounds
00094         # each comparison is worth a max of 100
00095         self.objMax = comps * 100
00096 
00097         # Create chromosome of widget ids
00098         gridChrom = [0] * self.gridSize
00099         gridChrom[:len(idList)] = idList[:]
00100         self.gridLen = len(gridChrom)
00101 
00102         # subjective component bounds
00103         # widgets + window
00104         #self.subjMax = ((widgetNum + 1) * 100.) + (100. * self.gridLen)
00105         self.subjMax = self.gridLen + self.geneLen
00106 
00107         # if comparing to best and worst, then increase subjective max scale accordingly
00108         if self.params['compare'] == 'both':
00109             self.subjMax *= 2
00110 
00111         self.widgetNum = widgetNum
00112         self.elementNodes = elementNodes
00113 
00114         pop = []
00115         for i in xrange(popsize):
00116             random.shuffle(gridChrom)
00117             pop.append(XulIndividual(None, None, {'grid':gridChrom[:], 'style':[random.randint(0, 1) for i in xrange(self.geneLen)]}))
00118 
00119         return pop
00120

00122 #-------------------------------------------#
00123     def fitness(self, ind, user_feedback):
00124         '''
00125         Compute fitness.
00126         user_feedback is [best,worst]
00127         '''
00128         best,worst = user_feedback
00129         subj = 0
00130         widgetNum = self.widgetNum
00131         if ind.genome == best.genome:
00132             subj = 2 * len(ind.genome['grid'])+len(ind.genome['style'])
00133         elif ind.genome == worst.genome:
00134             subj = 0
00135         else:
00136             #sum += lcs(ind.genome, best.genome)
00137             #sum += len(ind.genome)-lcs(ind.genome, worst.genome)
00138             subj += hamming(ind, best, worst)
00139 
00140 
00141         #-------------------------------------------------------------#
00142         # BEGIN OBJECTIVE EVALUATION
00143         #-------------------------------------------------------------#
00144         red = green = blue = 0
00145         colorFitness = 0
00146         myValues = self.decode(ind.genome['style'])
00147         # Compare widget colors, we want the colors to be similar, so a low value is good
00148         # start from 1, since at pos 0 we store window color
00149         for i in xrange(1, widgetNum - 1):
00150             for j in xrange(i + 1, widgetNum):
00151                 red = abs(myValues[i][0] - myValues[j][0])
00152                 green = abs(myValues[i][1] - myValues[j][1])
00153                 blue = abs(myValues[i][2] - myValues[j][2])
00154 
00155                 distance = (red*red + green*green + blue*blue)**0.5
00156 
00157                 colorFitness += (self.maxDist-distance) / self.maxDist * 100.
00158 
00159         windColor = 0
00160         # compare all widgets to the window color, we want a high color diff between each widget
00161         # and the background color
00162         # A high value is good
00163         for i in xrange(1, widgetNum):
00164             # window color is stored at pos 0
00165             red = abs(myValues[i][0] - myValues[0][0])
00166             green = abs(myValues[i][1] - myValues[0][1])
00167             blue = abs(myValues[i][2] - myValues[0][2])
00168 
00169             distance = (red*red + green*green + blue*blue)**0.5
00170             windColor += distance / self.maxDist * 100.
00171 
00172 
00173         obj = colorFitness + windColor
00174         #-------------------------------------------------------------#
00175         # END OBJECTIVE EVALUATION
00176         #-------------------------------------------------------------#
00177         subj = float(subj)
00178         # Scale objective and subjective fitness components
00179         objFitness = (obj-self.objMin)/(self.objMax-self.objMin) * self.objScaleMax + self.objScaleMin
00180         subjFitness = (subj-self.subjMin)/(self.subjMax-self.subjMin) * self.subjScaleMax + self.subjScaleMin
00181 
00182         w1, w2 = self.params['weight1'], self.params['weight2']
00183         #ind.scalefit = ind.fitness = objFitness * w1 + subjFitness * w2
00184         ind.objFitness = objFitness
00185         ind.subjFitness = subjFitness
00186         ind.fitness = [objFitness, subjFitness]
00187

00189 #-------------------------------------------#
00190     def draw(self, parentPanel, subset):
00191         '''
00192         Return a list of panels to be displayed to the user for evaluation.
00193         Use the arg parentPanel as the parent for each of the panels created.
00194         '''
00195         panels = []
00196         import evolveuipanel as individual_panel
00197         for i in xrange(len(subset)):
00198             grid = subset[i].genome['grid']
00199             style = self.decode(subset[i].genome['style'])
00200             panels.append(individual_panel.IndividualPanel(parentPanel, i, style, grid, self.uiWidgets))
00201 
00202         return panels

00261 #------------------------------------------#
00262     def decode(self, chromosome):
00263         '''
00264         Decodes the chromosome from binary to decimals or floats, or whatever it may be.
00265         '''
00266         # RGB DECODING
00267         values = []
00268         step = self.bits / 3
00269         for i in xrange(0, self.geneLen, self.bits):
00270             color = []
00271             color.append(int(string.joinfields(map(str, chromosome[i:i+step]), ''), 2))
00272             color.append(int(string.joinfields(map(str, chromosome[i+step:i+step*2]), ''), 2))
00273             color.append(int(string.joinfields(map(str, chromosome[i+step*2:i+step*3]), ''), 2))
00274 
00275             values.append(color)
00276 
00277         return values
00278

00280     def paramSpace(self, pop, user_selected):
00281         objmax = [self.objMax, self.subjMax]
00282         objmin = [self.objMin, self.subjMin]
00283         return objmax, objmin
